think_procedure: 1. Identify the knob in question: max_wal_size. 2. Determine if max_wal_size has any special values that deviate from its numerical ordering and perform a different function. 3. Research or recall that max_wal_size in PostgreSQL does not have special values like -1 or 0 that change its functionality fundamentally. It is used to specify the maximum size of the WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) files, and its value directly influences the checkpointing behavior without any special cases that alter its primary function. 4. Conclude that max_wal_size does not qualify as a 'special knob' based on the provided definition.
